attributes.action: Make it a legal recquirement for Pubs, Clubs, Restaurants and Cafés to provide drinking water free of charge.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is currently not a Legal recquirement to provide water in venues where customers may dehydrate due to excessive heat, or water loss due to sweating, that and the venues listed also serve alcohol, which as a diuretic, makes you dehydrate too. 

It is irresponsible for places where alcohol is served not to provide tap water for free, and does not encourage responsible drinking at all. Scotland have this made a legal recquirement in their licensing laws, so why not England and Wales? (See Licensing (Scotland) Act 2005, Schedule 3, s.9(2)).
